intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. ihrowyszczense, commonly known as the Polish hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, pastures, and along stream banks. It has a robust root system and produces numerous flowering stems that bear small, clustered flowers. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
